description: Minimal number of smaller integer-sided squares that tile an n X n square.
comments: Sascha Kurz has found a(n) for n <= 104, and up to this point he observes that a(n) is given by a(n) = min{ a(p) | p prime, p divides n } (cf. A211302). - __N. J. A. Sloane_, Apr 07 2012
references: S. Kurz, Squaring the square with integer linear programming, http://www.wm.uni-bayreuth.de/fileadmin/Sascha/Publikationen2/square.pdf
links: Ed Wynn, Table of n, a(n) for n = 2..126
Ed Wynn, Exhaustive generation of Mrs Perkins's quilt square dissections for low orders, 2013; arXiv:1308.5420
author: _David W. Wilson_
extensions: Extended by _David W. Wilson_, using values from A211302
Added b-file from Wynn, 2013. - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Nov 29 2013
